intro: Chaetogastra confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered chaetogastra, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
